Description: Large black burnished East Greek grey ware pottery trefoil oinochoe (reconstructed from numerous fragments); bulbous body; two light ridges below rim and triple ridges at top of shoulder; dark brown fabric core and sandy edges with mica and limestone inclusions; very worn black polish on exterior; handle missing and once replaced with plaster cast (since removed; metal pin used to fix it); inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: Previously identified as Etruscan (Rasmussen 3d), but now established as East Greek via NAA (Hans Mommsen, Bonn). Found unregistered in the British Museum, but ascribed to 'Naukratis?' by Donald Bailey when registered.
Bibliographic references: Etruscan Bucchero / A Catalogue of Etruscan Bucchero in the British Museum (No. 234)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.002)
